member.name: P:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.EntityMetadata.DefaultValueFunction
member.summary: Use to override how DevForce sets the default value for a data entity property.
member.remarks:
Use the DefaultValueFunction to override how DevForce determines the default value for a . If you do not specify an override, the value returned by is used. Note that the override is not on an Entity basis - the override will apply to all Entity types. For example, you may want to override the default DateTime value with your own code - this override would apply to DateTime data entity properties in all Entity types.
You must set your override for the DefaultValueFunction as early as possible in your processing. The DataEntityProperties of your entities are static fields of these entities, and will be initialized as the entity types are referenced.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.LoginCredential
member.summary: A credential for password-based authentication schemes.
member.remarks:
An ILoginCredential is passed to the Login method to validate a user.
In Silverlight and ASP.NET applications, the FormsAuthenticationLoginCredential can be used to control persistence of the authentication ticket.
Create a custom if you have specific requirements for the credentials provided to your .
Note that the credential is passed in clear text to the Entity Server. You should secure Entity Server communications using message or transport security.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.LoginException
member.summary: Exception that should be thrown within the implementation of an whenever a login attempt fails.
member.remarks:
The indicates the cause of the login failure.
If you subclass the LoginException and you have an n-tier application, your type should have a constructor accepting the message string. If your type has custom properties they will also be sent from the server as part of the Data property; you should include a constructor accepting the message string and a Dictionary<string, object> in order to reconstruct your custom LoginException successfully for the client.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.EntityServiceOption
member.summary: The EntityServiceOption is used to determine whether an should connect to a local or distributed Entity Service.
member.remarks:
By default an will always use the setting from the IdeaBlade Configuration file to determine whether to communicate with a local or distributed Entity Service. You can override this behavior by using an EntityManager constructor that takes an EntityServiceOption parameter.
The EntityServiceOption setting can be useful if you need to use both local and distributed data sources within the same application. You can construct one with the UseLocalService option, and then construct a second with the default setting.
If you use the UseDistributedService value, then you must ensure that the IdeaBlade Configuration file contains sufficient information to locate the Entity Service.

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.EntityServiceOption.UseDefaultService
member.summary: Use the setting from the IdeaBlade Configuration file.

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.EntityServiceOption.UseLocalService
member.summary: Ignore the IdeaBlade Configuration file setting and always use a local service for the EntityManager.

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.EntityServiceOption.UseDistributedService
member.summary: Ignore the IdeaBlade Configuration file setting and always use a distributed service for the EntityManager.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.QueryCache
member.summary: A list of queries that can be satisfied without having to go out to an external data source.
member.remarks: The QueryCache is managed by the and is used within the framework to determine which queries can be executed against cache only. Developers don't usually need to interact with the QueryCache, but you do have several means of controlling its contents. Use to access the cache. You will not usually need to directly add and remove queries from the cache, since EntityManager will manage it based on queries executed and entities removed.

member.name: M:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.QueryCache.Clear
member.summary: Clears the query cache.
member.remarks:
This does not remove any Entities from the cache. It simply clears the record of which queries have already been performed.
Clearing the query cache also results in subsequent queries retrieving data from the backend data source instead of cache, because the queries used for cached data are unknown.

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.FetchStrategy.CacheOnly
member.summary: Retrieve entities from the cache only.

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.FetchStrategy.DataSourceOnly
member.summary: Retrieve entities from the back-end data source only.

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.FetchStrategy.DataSourceThenCache
member.summary: Retrieve entities from the backend data source, add them to the cache, and then retrieve entites that are in the cache.

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.FetchStrategy.Optimized
member.summary: If the query is invertible then retrieve entities from the cache, and if not in cache, the back-end data source. If not the retrieve the entities from the back end data source only

member.name: F:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.FetchStrategy.DataSourceAndCache
member.summary: Retrieve entities from both the backend data source and the cache and merge the two result sets.

member.summary: Determines the options to use when restoring an .
member.remarks:
A RestoreStrategy is used when restoring an EntityCache with one of the methods of the .
The default RestoreStrategy will restore both the and settings from the EntityManager used when was called. Use a custom RestoreStrategy if you are restoring to another EntityManager with different settings which should not be overwritten.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.SaveOptions
member.summary: Options that can be used to control processing.
member.remarks:
Using SaveOptions you can specify the used during a save, to specify whether to fixup all generated temporary Ids or only those Ids corresponding to entities passed into the SaveChanges method, and to specify the entity types to be excluded from a post-save refetch.
The property may be used to pass custom information that can be used by a EntityServerSaveInterceptor to mediate the save operation.
The is not currently used. In a future release this property will allow you to set the entity order when saving to non-EDM data sources.
By default, is used and is set to All.

member.remarks: When false, save operation that contains entities with client validation errors will not proceed to the server. When true, client validation errors are ignored (cleared) and the save op will proceed to the server. Defaults to true.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.ServerMethodDelegate
member.summary:
Defines a delegate that a client uses to call a method on the server.
EntityManager.InvokeServerMethod
member.param: Represents the calling user
A server-side EntityManager (this is not the EntityManager on which the InvokeServerMethod call was made)
User-defined arguments
member.returns: Any serializable type
member.remarks: Any method which will be invoked via the EntityManager.InvokeServerMethod call must use this delegate signature.

example.code:
' Sample showing invocation of server method Dim mgr As EntityManager As New DomainModelEntityManager() Dim orderId As Integer = 10250 Dim mailSent As Boolean = CBool(mgr.InvokeServerMethod(Order.EmailOrderInfo, orderId))
' sample method defined in Order class Public Class Order '... Public Shared<AllowRpc()> _ Function EmailOrderInfo(pPrincipal As IPrincipal, pManager As EntityManager, ParamArray pArgs() As [Object]) As [Object] Dim orderId As Integer = Convert.ToInt32(pArgs(0))
' build and send an email message Dim from As String = "sales@mycompany.com" Dim [to] As String = "customer@yourcompany.com" Dim msg As New System.Net.Mail.MailMessage(from, [to])
msg.Subject = "Order Information" msg.Body = String.Format("Order id = {0} has been shipped", orderId)
Dim client As New System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient("localhost") Try client.Send(msg) Catch e As Exception TraceFns.WriteLine(e.Message) Return False End Try Return True End Function End Class

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.StoredProcQuery
member.summary: Not supported in DevForce 2010 RC1.
member.remarks:
The DevForce Object Mapper auto-generates two functions on the sub-typed EntityManager in your Domain Model for every stored procedure you've imported: the first returns a StoredProcQuery for the named procedure, and the second builds and executes a StoredProcQuery from the parameters provided and returns the results. To execute the StoredProcQuery returned by the first function mentioned, use or one of the available overloads.
These queries always use a of DataSourceOnly, and cannot be used when disconnected from the EntityServer.
You must have already defined a FunctionImport in your Entity Domain Model in order to use the StoredProcQuery; you may not execute a stored procedure defined in your database but unknown to your model.
Note: Stored procedures returning primitive data types are not currently supported, therefore the must always be an Entity.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.StoreGeneratedIdGenerator
member.summary: providing intrinsic framework support for store-generated IDs.
member.remarks:
This IdGenerator will automatically be used to provide a temporary property value for any new entities whose primary key is marked with the StoreGeneratedPattern="Identity" attribute in its entity model. You do not need to call for these properties, as this key generation is done for you.
If you do not wish to use this generator for your Identity properties you will need to provide a stub or custom implementation of .
The Entity Framework uses the StoreGeneratedPattern attribute to indicate properties whose value is provided by the data source after the row has been saved. The StoreGeneratedIdGenerator allows you to assign temporary values to these key fields, and will automatically map these temporary IDs to the real IDs assigned by the data source.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.EntityModel.FormsAuthenticationLoginCredential
member.summary: For use in applications using ASP.NET authentication services.
member.remarks:
Extends the to allow for specification of whether a FormsAuthentication ticket should be persistent.
It is not necessary to use the FormsAuthenticationLoginCredential in your Silverlight or ASP.NET application. If you use a with Forms authentication the authentication ticket will not persist after the session completes. You can also extend the interface for custom implementations.
